title: Stranger Things' Millie Bobby Brown is totally into ‘evil Eleven’ season 4 theory
text:
Could Eleven turn evil in the fourth season? (Picture: Netflix)

Warning: Contains spoilers for Stranger Things season three.

Millie Bobby Brown has responded to a Stranger Things fan theory which believes Eleven could turn evil, and she’s digging the idea.

While many might be wondering if Hopper is still alive after the show’s third season, some fans believe Eleven could have been infected by the Mind Flayer after a part of its flesh got stuck on her leg, potentially turning her into a villain for the next season.

Millie Bobby Brown, who plays Eleven, has since given her verdict on this very theory – and she’s a bit freaked out by the possibility of it.

Asked by Elle about the theory, Millie said: ‘I kind of like it! I’m into it. I wasn’t playing it like that. We don’t know what happens in season four. I definitely don’t.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘In scenes after the Mind Flayer grabbed me, I wasn’t playing it as I was infected. I was definitely playing it as normal as possible. And maybe that’s the reason they didn’t tell me. To make it as real as possible. I don’t know.

Stranger Things 3 was a huge hit (Picture: Netflix)

‘Those theories freak me out a bit. Because I’m like, “Oh god, that could genuinely be true.” And what if she is the villain? That would be so cool. Wouldn’t that be cool? I’d love to be the villain, but then I also wouldn’t because Eleven is perfect. It would suck.’

While it could be a tricky path for creators The Duffer Brothers to navigate, the idea of Eleven turning evil would be an interesting twist – especially after her powers have become a crutch for Mike (Finn Wolfhard), Dustin (Gaten Matarazzo), Lucas (Caleb McLaughlin) and Will (Noah Schnapp).

Netflix recently confirmed Stranger Things season 4 is in the works for 2020, following positive reception from audiences and critics to the show’s third outing.

The Duffer Brothers have also signed a multi-year deal to produce television series and films for Netflix.

Speaking about the deal and renewal, the Duffer Brothers said: ‘We are absolutely thrilled to continue our relationship with Netflix. Ted Sarandos, Cindy Holland, Brian Wright, and Matt Thunell took a huge chance on us and our show – and forever changed our lives.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘From our first pitch meeting to the release of Stranger Things 3, the entire team at Netflix has been nothing short of sensational, providing us with the kind of support, guidance, and creative freedom we always dreamed about. We can’t wait to tell many more stories together – beginning, of course, with a return trip to Hawkins!’

Stranger Things season 4 will release on Netflix in 2020.

description: Millie Bobby Brown has responded to a theory Eleven could turn evil in Stranger Things season 4.
